thread.title: Premier League champions Leicester City are the worst team in the whole of England in 2017
thread.title_full: Premier League champions Leicester City are the worst team in the whole of England in 2017

author: Liam Corless
title: Premier League champions Leicester City are the worst team in the whole of England in 2017
text:
Sport Premier League champions Leicester City are the worst team in the whole of England in 2017 The Foxes are in free fall after a run of one draw and five defeats in their last six top flight matches Share Premier League champions Leicester are on a rotten run of form (Photo: Plumb Images) Share Get football updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Leicester are the worst team in England's top four divisions in 2017 after a dismal start to the year. 
Last year's surprise Premier League champions have picked up just one point from six top-flight matches, scoring no goals and conceding 12. 
Only three other teams out of the remaining 91 professional clubs in the English football league pyramid have picked up just one point since the turn of the year. 
Aston Villa, Coventry and Leyton Orient each have a solitary point to their names in 2017, but all three of those teams have better goal difference than the Foxes, making Ranieri's side the worst-performing team in England this year. Read More Leicester were beaten 2-0 by fellow strugglers Swansea on Sunday (Photo: AFP) The Foxes are in free fall after a dreadful start to the year (Photo: Stu Forster) Worst six teams in Premier League and EFL in 2017 Team
